headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I would like to thank you for joining us today for our 2017 results conference call.I'm joined today by our CEO, Tobías Martínez; and José Manuel Ais
componenttext:
Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I would like to thank you for joining us today for our 2017 results conference call.
I'm joined today by our CEO, Tobías Martínez; and José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director. They will lead today's presentation. We have posted this morning a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks, and then we'll open the line for a Q&A session. The total duration scheduled for this session is around 1 hour. So after this time, our team will be at your disposal to answer any [indiscernible].
So now please, Tobías.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, thank you very much, Juan. Good afternoon, everyone, and thank you so much for your time today. Let me please start this presentation highlighting the main milestones of the year, a year that has been marked by a strong execution and market recognit
componenttext:
Well, thank you very much, Juan. Good afternoon, everyone, and thank you so much for your time today. Let me please start this presentation highlighting the main milestones of the year, a year that has been marked by a strong execution and market recognition.
First of all, I have to say that we are continuing to deliver on organic performance, reaching the upper part of our guidance for 2017. If you remember, our guidance was from 3% to 4%, and we reached 4% -- we have reached 4%.
We are continuing generating a strong leverage free cash flow, growing a solid 10% in the year. Third, we are managing a sustainable business model that today offer EUR 16 billion of contracted revenues. So as a result of young and long-term contracts that improved our business file.
We are executing on our equity story by growing in new and in existing markets and reinforcing our industrial partnership with key players. As you know, we are consolidating our market positioning in Spain and The Netherlands. We are executing several transactions in France, in all the countries where we are today.
The fourth part is related with the structural flexibility on our approach to fund financing growth, with around EUR 2 billion of available liquidity and a very efficient capital structure. As you can see, we are talking about maturities beyond 6 years and an average cost a bit below 2%.
And finally, we believe that the quality of this execution has been recognized by the market, with a share price that has increased 56% in year 2017.
On Slide #5, you can see a very strong performance on our key value metrics, with our adjusted EBITDA growing annually around 25% and our recurring leverage free cash flow per share growing annually at the similar rate over the last 2, 3 years.
If we move to Slide #6, we are showing you a summary of the principal of the 8 deals we have executed in 2017. All in all, we have added 8,000 sites to our footprint on a pro forma basis, and we have committed a total enterprise value of around EUR 2 billion, and we have multiplied our portfolio size since our IPO by 4x.
It's very important to highlight that the European sector is accelerating on our view. The Cellnex project trying to reach a European platform. So we are envisaging as well '18 -- 2018 with a very positive perspective.
On Slide #7, we can see the results of our growth strategy, with around 70% of our revenues to be generated by telecom infrastructure rather than almost 80% when -- in 2014.
Around 60% of our adjusted EBITDA is generated outside of Spain in a pro forma basis. So all in all, we are transforming a single-country company in a single or mainly a broadcasting company in a telecom outsourcing infrastructure company, and really an international and a European company.
You can see in the left side of this slide the spread of our footprint across the countries where we are delivering today our services.
And well, I pass the floor to José Manuel to move to the business performance.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías, and good afternoon, everyone. Moving to Slide 9. Total PoPs have increased 22% in the period, including the contribution of both organic and change of perimeter in the year.If we now focus on organic growth only, PoPs and our consoli
componenttext:
Thank you, Tobías, and good afternoon, everyone. Moving to Slide 9. Total PoPs have increased 22% in the period, including the contribution of both organic and change of perimeter in the year.
If we now focus on organic growth only, PoPs and our consolidated customer ratio have increased 4%, at the top end of our medium-term guidance between 3% and 4%.
Finally, DAS or DAS nodes, have increased 26% in the year, and we are optimistic that this new business area will become a significant contributor to Cellnex' revenues in the future. Please note, that this is the beginning of 5G.
Moving to Slide 10. You can see the evolution of PoPs and our consolidated customer ratio, with increases mainly explained by consistent organic growth and change of perimeter. We have managed to add more than 1,000 organic PoPs year-on-year basis, reaching a customer ratio of 1.55. A change of perimeter is also considered, usually contributing with a lower ratio.
Additionally, we are implementing several commercial initiatives to secure future organic growth. We're strengthening our partnership with key customers. We are working under existing framework agreements to secure new tenants. We are implementing new small cell projects and exploring opportunities to provide densification solutions in dense urban areas. Finally, Cellnex has been certified as Zero Outage Supplier by Deutsche Telekom.
Let me now please explain on Slide 11 our recurring levered free cash flow generation in the period. I would like to start highlighting that the cash conversion ratio of EBITDA into recurring levered free cash flow has been a strong circa 80%, with a significant margin expansion of 400 basis points in our EBITDA margin.
Moving to revenues. The contribution from telecom services and broadcasting increased, with a very well-managed cost base, leading to an adjusted EBITDA increase of 22%.
Maintenance CapEx is in line with our guidance. Our change in working capital is slightly positive. Interest paid reflect our capital structure as of end of the year, and taxes reflect our management measures in place. All in all, we are providing today a 12% revenue growth, which implies almost doubling our adjusted EBITDA growth when compared to 2016.
Moving now to our balance sheet on Slide 12. It is important to highlight the strong liquidity position of the company. With circa-2 billion after the issuance of our first convertible bond in January and the very high level of contracted revenues, with a backlog of EUR 16 billion, or in other words, 20 years of revenues or 7x our net debt.
Compared to December 2016, our balance sheet mostly reflects the increase in debt instruments and the associated cash, and proceeds have been used in the execution of our growth strategy.
Cellnex leverage as of December 2017 reached 5.5x on a net debt EBITDA basis, which includes the full year contribution from the new transactions in both debt and adjusted EBITDA.
Moving toward capital structure on Slide 13. You can see our current debt maturity profile. Our debt has an average maturity of around 6.5 years. There is no material refinancing before 2022, and we do have a strong protection against interest rate increases as a result of our fixed rate debt and also our inflation indexation of our revenues.
In summary, in relation to our capital structure, I would like to emphasize the following points: a strong available liquidity position of EUR 2 billion, backlog of EUR 16 billion, no required short-term refinancing, long maturities, highly attractive terms, a compelling business risk profile and no financing restrictions. And these give us access to several alternatives to fund growth. Cash from ongoing operations, this structure in tranches access to a wide array of debt instruments, financing a project level and also potential equity finance at the OpCo level.
On Slide 14, we are presenting to you the main characteristics of our first convertible bond we issued in January. For us, the issuance has been a landmark transaction, allowing us to diversify our funding sources, extend our maturities and reduce our average cost of debt, with the highest conversion premium in Europe.
And finally, just a few words on financial outlook in Slide 15. We have beaten our 2017 guidance by delivering on all the different contribution lines.
On the right-hand side, you can also find a detailed explanation of our adjusted EBITDA performance in the year. You can see the positive impact of the new TV channels being reinforced by the contribution of organic growth and efficiencies as well as, of course, the change of perimeter. These, altogether, explain the strong adjusted EBITDA growth in the period of 22%.
Moving to our 2018 financial outlook. Our adjusted EBITDA is expected to reach between EUR 405 million and EUR 415 million. We believe we can provide a recurring level free cash flow at least 10% higher than in 2017. Our CapEx guidance remains unchanged, and dividends will increase by 10% as per our current dividend policy.
And with this, we are more than happy to answer any questions you may have. And please note that, in the following slides, you will also find the frequently asked questions that all of you, you raised to the company, and also in our website, a very thorough Excel sheet. And on top of that, of course, the annual accounts with every single detail. Thank you very much.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] The first question comes from Simon Coles from Barclays.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] The first question comes from Simon Coles from Barclays.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: The first one is on France. I saw that you've announced a further 1,000 sites you built in France. I'm just wondering if you can give us some more color on how that came about? Are you seeing more operators willing to cooperate and outsource talent there
componenttext: The first one is on France. I saw that you've announced a further 1,000 sites you built in France. I'm just wondering if you can give us some more color on how that came about? Are you seeing more operators willing to cooperate and outsource talent there as you've had a lot of success so far? And are you going to be able to market those talents immediately for the other operators? That's the first question. On the second one, you're starting to gain scale in France, you already have scale in all your other markets, though, you only need to still to work on, I guess, the U.K. and Netherlands. Is this where you're seeing more scope for upside into 2018? What are you seeing in these markets? What are the opportunities that could potentially materialize? And then, on the third one, I guess, linked to the other 2, if you could give any more color around how you're seeing operators engage with you? Are you seeing them more open? Are they coming to you now? You said you're confident on more activity in 2018 earlier, Tobías, so anymore color around that would be very useful.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you. You had several questions, Simon. Let's just start with number one, and I think it's very similar to number 3, so I will tackle both of them at the same time. Yes, you are right and your understanding is correct, we have reached an agreement to
componenttext: Thank you. You had several questions, Simon. Let's just start with number one, and I think it's very similar to number 3, so I will tackle both of them at the same time. Yes, you are right and your understanding is correct, we have reached an agreement to build to suit 1,000 sites -- up to 1,000 sites in France. And this can be -- this is very well explained in Slide #18. If you compare Slide #18 with our Capital Market Day, you will see that we have included a green box that tells you when Cellnex think it's going to implement this new agreement. And as you can see, it will take later in this period. So it will not be before 2021. So yes, it is true, this new agreement will take place between 2022 and '23. And this is again very linked to your third question, which was about if MNOs are more open to work with us, the answer, clearly, is yes. Step by step as Cellnex commits and performs and gives a good service to our client, these clients, current clients and potential new clients are more open to explore further collaborations with Cellnex. And this is a philosophy of Cellnex, long-term agreement in on a win-win basis.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: And there was one remaining question, Simon, which was your question #2. It is true that today, we are in the process of building a scale, both in the U.K. and Netherlands, and we are pursuing several opportunities in both countries. Maybe in the U.K., it
componenttext: And there was one remaining question, Simon, which was your question #2. It is true that today, we are in the process of building a scale, both in the U.K. and Netherlands, and we are pursuing several opportunities in both countries. Maybe in the U.K., it is true that maybe our focus is trying to provide solutions for densification in dense urban areas. So maybe in the shorter term, you should be expecting more push on organic growth rather than M&A. And we are pursuing several paths in The Netherlands in order to continue growing our portfolio.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018

componenttext: The next question comes from Jonathan Dann from RBC.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018

componenttext: There's 2. I think towards the back of the slides, you talked about EUR 42 million of CapEx for, I guess, purchasing leases in advance. I guess, my question is does that directly impact OpEx in 2018? And then my second is then, I guess, there now appears to be a lot of tower portfolios for sale, France, Italy, Portugal, Netherlands. But are you able to sort of narrow down the range of -- what are we likely to sort of hear from you guys around these portfolios?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you for your question. Listen, yes, you are right. In the last quarter of the year, we've had somehow accelerated our efficiency program through a land acquisition execution. And yes, of course, this should be somehow considered in our OpEx of 2018.
componenttext: Thank you for your question. Listen, yes, you are right. In the last quarter of the year, we've had somehow accelerated our efficiency program through a land acquisition execution. And yes, of course, this should be somehow considered in our OpEx of 2018. It is true that when you invest money, you don't get everything the first day. You'd get everything step by step, but yes, it is true that this is an investment that should have impact. Regarding your second question, and it's an open question, you talked about France, Italy, Europe in general. Jonathan, you know very well the company. We do have 2 kind of deals, those deals that are visible and all the market is keeping an eye on them. And other deals in which we are proprietary and we like working step-by-step with the client. Many times, the client is already a client and many times the client is a new client. What I can tell you is that in the first type of deals, we are obviously working, we are obviously devoting time to be prepared. But at the same time, on the second side of the deals, we are also very focused on giving solution and also trying to the table or giving -- bringing to the table all the value from Cellnex. And I can tell you that between these 2 kind of deals, visible and non-visible, they are in the Europe as you were explaining, in all of them. And what I can tell you is that everything is Western Europe, and this is what we think. It's our main focus.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Can I ask a follow-up on the land? Was it the EUR 42 million? Was that a series of different acquisitions? Or was it sort of one block?
componenttext: Can I ask a follow-up on the land? Was it the EUR 42 million? Was that a series of different acquisitions? Or was it sort of one block?

componenttextpreview: A series. It's a series. We've given that out. If you refer to the expansion CapEx, I mean, the -- as you know, what we are trying to do here mostly -- especially our spend in Italy. We are very much sure [indiscernible]. So land acquisition is something
componenttext: A series. It's a series. We've given that out. If you refer to the expansion CapEx, I mean, the -- as you know, what we are trying to do here mostly -- especially our spend in Italy. We are very much sure [indiscernible]. So land acquisition is something that we are pursuing as well, but the majority of the CapEx you are seeing today being deployed is used for prepaying many years of using our banks.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question comes from Giles Thorne from Jefferies.
componenttext: The next question comes from Giles Thorne from Jefferies.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: I had 3 questions, please. I wanted to start with Iliad. Iliad shown again and again that it doesn't really feel the need to own passive infrastructure, but ironically, they now own quite a lot of it with the Xavier Niel and NJJ acquisition of Eir in Irel
componenttext: I had 3 questions, please. I wanted to start with Iliad. Iliad shown again and again that it doesn't really feel the need to own passive infrastructure, but ironically, they now own quite a lot of it with the Xavier Niel and NJJ acquisition of Eir in Ireland. So my question is do you see anything structural about the Irish market that you dislike? And could your framework agreements in Italy and France be a blueprint for Ireland? My second question was around 5G. Your ambitions clearly building very quickly, but it seems that across Europe, there's a chronic lack of fiber infrastructure running to macro towers. To date, you've shown mild interest in fiber backhaul investments. Will this change as you prepare Cellnex to become the industrial partner of choice for 5G? And then finally, on Germany and Deutsche Telekom, Tobías, you described in an interview recently that the relationship with Deutsche Telekom Capital Partners was strategic rather than financial, what did you mean by that exactly?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Giles, thank you so much for your questions. The short answer on your first one, today, we aren't pursuing any specific opportunity in the -- in Ireland, okay? So a question also on fiber.
componenttext: Giles, thank you so much for your questions. The short answer on your first one, today, we aren't pursuing any specific opportunity in the -- in Ireland, okay? So a question also on fiber.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, of course, this is that gels particularly well [indiscernible] this is an industrial player. We are fully aware of the characteristics of the 5G and all the requirements. And not only regarding the fiber to the tower, also regarding the data centers
componenttext: Yes, of course, this is that gels particularly well [indiscernible] this is an industrial player. We are fully aware of the characteristics of the 5G and all the requirements. And not only regarding the fiber to the tower, also regarding the data centers and many other angles that have to be really, really work -- working on time. And the answer is yes, this is a step-by-step process and we are working several angles. And I can tell you that our clients will be fully prepared to face this challenge, to face this opportunity in the best condition. And maybe Tobias...

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, coming back to your question about Deutsche Telekom. Well, nothing different, you have -- you know that we have a very good relationship with them, thanks to our Swiss project. This is a fact, this is a real project, and this is the best way to show
componenttext: Well, coming back to your question about Deutsche Telekom. Well, nothing different, you have -- you know that we have a very good relationship with them, thanks to our Swiss project. This is a fact, this is a real project, and this is the best way to show what can we do for them managing the passive infrastructure, but no further commitments so far. And this is the reason why I -- my comment was that we have a very good relationship, we have a strategic relationship. Of course, our partnership in Switzerland is not based on financial issues or financial objectives. Its more -- in order to get a real case, a real opportunity to know better each other. And so far so good. But up today anything else.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Did they ever tell you why they left the Deutsche Towers in a separate subsidiary after they put Telexius and T-Mobile together in there -- that country? It's a tricky question.
componenttext: Did they ever tell you why they left the Deutsche Towers in a separate subsidiary after they put Telexius and T-Mobile together in there -- that country? It's a tricky question.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, this is a question for Deutsche Telekom, Thorne. But obviously, for us, will be an attractive opportunity, why not. We are a tower company. We have -- I may -- if I may, a very small footprint in the Netherlands and for us will be an opportunity, bu
componenttext: Well, this is a question for Deutsche Telekom, Thorne. But obviously, for us, will be an attractive opportunity, why not. We are a tower company. We have -- I may -- if I may, a very small footprint in the Netherlands and for us will be an opportunity, but it just maybe a name rather than a reality. This is the reason why I'm very prudent telling you that this is just our aim. Today, I cannot tell you that we have any agreement beyond that.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question comes from Ottavio Adorisio from Société Générale.
componenttext: The next question comes from Ottavio Adorisio from Société Générale.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: A few more question on my side. The first one is on build to suit. Looking at your numbers, it looks that build to suit have consumed around EUR 52 million of CapEx. But I can't find a lot of details in terms of -- the towers been built and also some gran
componenttext: A few more question on my side. The first one is on build to suit. Looking at your numbers, it looks that build to suit have consumed around EUR 52 million of CapEx. But I can't find a lot of details in terms of -- the towers been built and also some granularity about the future. You guide on maintenance and the growth CapEx, but I understand that BTS is not included. So if you can just give us a bit of color as how the profile for BTS CapEx would evolve in the next couple of years? And then the second one is tied up on this one, because for the first time also provide the upside the BTS project gives to you. And it's pretty difficult to grasp from a chart, sort of, EBITDA you're thinking to achieve in 2023 for BTS with WIG. And that will be good if you can give us a bit of colors on a number, even if a range. And that number -- that include any additional BTS that could be triggered by the [indiscernible] announcement in January. And the very last one, it's basically on your free cash flow and EBITDA guidance. You're guiding for an EBITDA that -- midrange a guidance will be in excess of 15% and free cash flow above 10. Now you also tell that maintenance CapEx will remain relatively in line as percentage of sales. And you kept the interest rates lower in the recent financing. So I was wondering it's -- any reasons for us to assume that free cash, will it grow less than EBITDA into the New Year. There is anything, sort of, movements on working capital or taxes that could dilute the growth from EBITDA rather than just enhancing it?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Ottavio, thank you for your questions. And let me start by the end, because maybe you have the questions in 2 blocks now. The second one is regarding the free cash flow and how it compares with EBITDA growth. Yes, you are right, you are right, I think tha
componenttext: Ottavio, thank you for your questions. And let me start by the end, because maybe you have the questions in 2 blocks now. The second one is regarding the free cash flow and how it compares with EBITDA growth. Yes, you are right, you are right, I think that when we give the guidance of record level free cash flow, we say to you more than 10%. More than 10% does not mean 10% or 11%. We do think that evolution of EBITDA and evolution of recurrent level of free cash flow will be coherent. So there is nothing related to working capital. There is nothing relating to tax that also will be in the same line. There is nothing related to cap -- maintenance, CapEx that we are saying circa 3%. It is the only thing that you have to estimate well is the interest expense. So it's quite straightforward. I think that, again, that we are a proven company. We tend to maintain the information we give to you in this case, last year, so the main way to present things. And yes, you are right, everything will be coherent. In 1 year time you will see that you -- this question was right and the answer are so coherent. Maybe Juan Jose you can help us in the first block of questions?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, if I got properly there were 3 questions from -- on build to suit. On the EUR 52 million, we have explained this quarter, the vast majority is devoted to the build to suit program. We have already announced with WIG Telecom. As you know, at the momen
componenttext: Yes, if I got properly there were 3 questions from -- on build to suit. On the EUR 52 million, we have explained this quarter, the vast majority is devoted to the build to suit program. We have already announced with WIG Telecom. As you know, at the moment of the first field we announced the 1st of February, there were 2 tranches, the acquisition of 1,800 existing sites plus the construction of 1,200 sites. While we believe that the contribution in terms of EBITDA of these sites to be built will be seen later, and this relates to your second question, we are still incurring some cost. So you are beginning to see the cost associated with that product. And since, I would say those 2 projects with Telecom in France and then Sunrise in Switzerland are very well identified and quantified with the market, so that's why we are providing this information, not include in our traditional expansion CapEx. On the first -- second question, the reason why we are providing [ acute ] is, well, to give the idea that this will be a [indiscernible] process, as I explained earlier. We have several windows of transferring existing sites, this is why our towers in France are growing because of our agreement we have with                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 WIG Telecom. And then on top of that, there's a 5-year program in order to end up building this 1,200 sites for -- with Telecom. Given that we don't really have feasibility on -- when we will be having these towers in place, that's why we believe that this process will be gradual. But in the case the final feature in terms of EBITDA is the sum of the different tranches we have already announced we are working. On the asset. Its upside, I mean. This is a very recent news for us. We believe that it's an opportunity. We -- as you know we already have an industrial partnership with WIG in France. So anything we can do for them we will continue to do so and with other operators as well. It's a matter of -- to win, if we find the right angle, happy to help them.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: And it's a very, very quick follow-up. About the -- the build to suit, I remember one in the early stages in the IPO. You also give a bit of granularity about that is not a straight forward exercise because you have identified that by the land and the old
componenttext: And it's a very, very quick follow-up. About the -- the build to suit, I remember one in the early stages in the IPO. You also give a bit of granularity about that is not a straight forward exercise because you have identified that by the land and the older -- the permits. How is basically been your experience so far in France with WIG, and with Sunrise in Switzerland?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Very good because we had a lot of experience, we are working and we are facing together in this build to suit program. I think this is the key element in order to reach all the objectives. And the same with Sunrise, when we factorized 400 recontract price
componenttext: Very good because we had a lot of experience, we are working and we are facing together in this build to suit program. I think this is the key element in order to reach all the objectives. And the same with Sunrise, when we factorized 400 recontract price have already contracted 400 build to suit in Switzerland, is in 5 years plan. So we are using, if I may, the current suppliers of WIG, the current suppliers of Sunrise in order to take all the experience and the benefit of using this partnership, these existing partners.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question comes from [ Albert ] [indiscernible] from Kempton.
componenttext: The next question comes from [ Albert ] [indiscernible] from Kempton.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: A small question, a bit more practical. Build basically on my previous colleague with regards to build to suit and the existing towers in France, I was just wondering, as of 31st of December, 2017, how many towers of the existing towers had been transferr
componenttext: A small question, a bit more practical. Build basically on my previous colleague with regards to build to suit and the existing towers in France, I was just wondering, as of 31st of December, 2017, how many towers of the existing towers had been transferred? And how many build to suit were actually already constructed? Then, more on the debt side. I remember having a discussion with Juan on the amount of debt you could issue. You were allowed, by statutory or by board approval, to issue a convertible of EUR 750 million. You issued EUR 600 million, does it imply that without having additional board approval you can issue the remaining EUR 150 million? And then a more strategic question, in the sense that what kind of structural leverage level would you feel comfortable with, especially in light of potential rising rates.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, [ Albert ]. Short answer on your first question. As of the end of 2017, we have in France 1,016 -- 600 -- sorry, 1,600 sites. Remember that in 2016 we already agreed with Telekom the acquisition of 500 sites. So these 1,600 sites we have in Fra
componenttext: Thank you, [ Albert ]. Short answer on your first question. As of the end of 2017, we have in France 1,016 -- 600 -- sorry, 1,600 sites. Remember that in 2016 we already agreed with Telekom the acquisition of 500 sites. So these 1,600 sites we have in France is the combination of the initial 500 sites we acquired in 2016, plus 1,300 coming from the bigger deal we announced in February, 2017.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, regarding the debt question. Have to pass, first of all, regarding the convertible bond delegation of the GSM remitting into the Board of Directors. According to the Spanish law, the maximum delegation is EUR 750 million. This is in fact the delegati
componenttext: Yes, regarding the debt question. Have to pass, first of all, regarding the convertible bond delegation of the GSM remitting into the Board of Directors. According to the Spanish law, the maximum delegation is EUR 750 million. This is in fact the delegation that the Board of Director of Cellnex has. As you suggest, once we have issued 600 million, our current delegation for convertible bonds accounts for EUR 150 million. So yes, you are right, with your math. Regarding the debt and the capacity to go into more debt. So we have answered these questions every single quarter. And it's a good question, but I think that it has to be framed in the right context. And in -- I do think that when we talk about net debt EBITDA, when we talk about leverage, we have to frame this within the business risk profile of the company. The business risk profile of Cellnex since the last 3 years has changed dramatically, has improved significantly. And this has allow us to maintain or to improve our net debt EBITDA, to increase our net debt EBITDA and at the same time maintaining a very similar or the same credit quality. We have prepare some slides, 21, 22, 23 and 24, to answer the question. If I go to the key point, I will say to you when accessing debt leverage of Cellnex, please note that we do have EUR 16 billion of contracted revenues. And this means 7x our net debt. This is a first concept, I will say. Second, please note that our business risk profile is very strong. It's not excellent yet, but it's very strong. And you know that as the more strong business risk profile is the better or the higher the net debt can be. So our management, all the team is focused on improving the business risk profile. And finally, in Slide 23, you will find our capacity to delever the company every single year. You can see that these accounts for 0.6x net debt EBITDA of the leverage every year. So all of this is helpful when estimating the potential sell power of Cellnex. I think that this slide give answer to you.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: I had 2 questions. Firstly, I was just wondering if you could talk a little bit about Italy. Obviously, you have descent PoP growth about, I guess, you've added about $0.05 cents in your base in 2017, but you're not growing revenues, I guess you've got he
componenttext: I had 2 questions. Firstly, I was just wondering if you could talk a little bit about Italy. Obviously, you have descent PoP growth about, I guess, you've added about $0.05 cents in your base in 2017, but you're not growing revenues, I guess you've got headwinds from -- I know that CommsCon revenues can be a bit lumpy and also wind for the installations, sort of one-off type revenues and then you got the LNG pass comps. Can you talk a little bit about how the -- what's the underlying service site leasing revenue trends are? And also about how we should think about the comps as we go into 2018 presumably that business can go back to top line growth hopefully. The second question is the deal you've made with [indiscernible] on managing the motorway sites. How come it became a management agreement rather than the straight, sort of, acquisition of the sites? Is this just sort of a try out how it works and you can do more similar deals, or was this just basically an opportunity that came up and you went for it?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Henrik. Maybe on the last one, I mean, these -- this is part of our concession. I mean the degree of involvement we can take is very limited, so this has been opportunistic. They continue to own the site. We'll be commercializing them, and that
componenttext: Thank you, Henrik. Maybe on the last one, I mean, these -- this is part of our concession. I mean the degree of involvement we can take is very limited, so this has been opportunistic. They continue to own the site. We'll be commercializing them, and that -- than we'll have revenue shared in the connection in place. In any case, we are not expecting a significant impact. We are opportunistic, and we are happy with the outcome. On Italy, you need to remember that when we presented the Galata transaction, there were 3 different ledgers. So revenues from wind, one is the base fee, second is the electricity fee and the third piece is the LTE revenues, they have station works for the network. In 2015, we didn't adapt as many towers as we would apply. We caught up in 2016, so we manage to adapt all of the sites plan for the year, plus those we couldn't in 2015. And in 2017, we are coming back to a normalized level. So hence, that -- I would say that this decline in this specific service is offsetting -- is offset by organic growth. So that's why you don't really see the increase in revenues. We do have the organic growth, we do have CommsCon performance, but slight decline in the LTE revenues, we are coming -- we are receiving from wind. On the decommissioning, well you know that we have 2 different agreements in place and you should be seeing the progress in this year in 2018.

And the second one is, if you have any plan to buy new towers for this year? And how would you plan to finance it?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2017 Earnings Call, Feb 16, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay, your first question, regarding your question, its M&A. Well, listen, we are what -- you have seen at the beginning of the presentation what we have done in 2017. So it's a step-by-step progress. We are working different deals, and I think that all t
componenttext: Okay, your first question, regarding your question, its M&A. Well, listen, we are what -- you have seen at the beginning of the presentation what we have done in 2017. So it's a step-by-step progress. We are working different deals, and I think that all these deals we are well working for us. What is very important is not the deal, only the deal itself, but the money criteria. And the money criteria has to be met, which means that at the end of the day our business profile has to improve. The equity area has to be at least low double-digit, and of course, their cash flow per share, the recurring cash flow per share has to be accretive from year 2, 3, onwards. So you must have more cash per share. So yes, focus on M&A, but also on the methodology of M&A, in order to bring you new numbers in the different quarters that are more compelling. Your second question, to be honest, I have not been able to understand it in detail. So if you could repeat, I would appreciate it.

componenttextpreview: Sure. If -- I would like to know if you have any plan to buy new towers? And if so how would you finance it?
componenttext: Sure. If -- I would like to know if you have any plan to buy new towers? And if so how would you finance it?

componenttext: Yes. While we do have plans to buy the towers, it's very similar to what I said before. Yes, we are watching different opportunities, but we have strict interest over money, so both things have to be understood at the same time. And how to finance, you can find in the presentation that as of today we have EUR 900 million of cash at our hands. So I do think that we should take advantage of this money.
